achievements.title: Implemented Achievement Impact Rating System with UI Enhancements
achievements.summary: Developed a comprehensive impact rating system for achievements, including a 3-star UI, impact source tracking, and improved achievement list layout.
achievements.details: Implemented a comprehensive impact rating system for achievements that allows both user and LLM-assigned ratings. Key changes include: - Add impact rating UI with 3-star system and tooltips - Track impact source (user/llm) and last update time - Show impact level labels (Low/Medium/High) in achievement dialog - Fix achievement form submission with proper type handling - Add impact fields to achievement generator for testing - Update achievement list UI with more compact layout - Increase achievements per page from 10 to 20 The feature enables users to: - Rate achievements from low to high impact (1-3 stars) - See clear visual feedback about impact levels - Track whether ratings came from users or LLM - View when ratings were last updated Technical improvements: - Proper null handling for optional fields - Type-safe achievement mutations - Optimistic UI updates for ratings - Consistent database schema updates

achievements.title: Implemented Achievement Impact Rating System
achievements.summary: Developed a comprehensive impact rating system for achievements, including UI enhancements and database updates.
achievements.details: Implemented a comprehensive impact rating system for achievements that allows both user and LLM-assigned ratings. Key changes include adding an impact rating UI with a 3-star system and tooltips, tracking impact source (user/LLM) and last update time, showing impact level labels (Low/Medium/High) in the achievement dialog, fixing achievement form submission with proper type handling, adding impact fields to the achievement generator for testing, updating the achievement list UI with a more compact layout, and increasing achievements per page from 10 to 20. Technical improvements include proper null handling for optional fields, type-safe achievement mutations, optimistic UI updates for ratings, and consistent database schema updates.

achievements.title: Implemented API Client for CLI with Project Sync
achievements.summary: Added an API client to the CLI for authenticated requests and project synchronization with the web app.
achievements.details: Commit 26a48d154a375c7884c342c51337ca7d4c8af1a0 added a new API client to facilitate authenticated requests to the Bragdoc API from the CLI. It introduced error handling for unauthenticated access via custom error classes and enhanced project synchronization by implementing logic to find or create projects based on repository remote URLs. The command line interface was updated to support project syncing during repository addition, and an 'init' alias was introduced for easier onboarding.

achievements.title: Migrated LLM Achievement Extraction to CLI
achievements.summary: Moved achievement extraction logic from the web API to the CLI, enabling local processing with OpenAI API key.
achievements.details: Commit 917f2f5b451b5dc23fd111d4a9e2bcdaaa81578c implemented a major architectural change that moved achievement extraction logic from the Bragdoc web API to the CLI tool. This enabled local processing of Git commits using the user's own OpenAI API key. The CLI now requires the `OPENAI_API_KEY` environment variable, and repositories must have a projectId set up using `bragdoc init`.

achievements.title: Implemented AI-Powered Reports Feature for Manager Updates
achievements.summary: Developed a comprehensive feature for generating AI-powered reports, integrating with existing systems and enhancing user experience.
achievements.details: Add comprehensive 'For my manager' reports feature that allows users to generate AI-powered documents from their tracked achievements. This feature imports and adapts the reports UI from the v0-app prototype, integrating it with the main BragDoc application's existing database, API, and AI infrastructure. Users can now create weekly, monthly, and custom reports by selecting achievements and customizing generation prompts, with all documents saved to the database for future reference and management. The implementation includes a reports listing page (Server Component) that fetches documents with company joins and passes data to an interactive client component for filtering and deletion. The new report creation pages (dynamic routes for /reports/new/[type]) fetch achievements based on configurable time ranges (7 days for weekly, 30 days for monthly, all-time for custom), with real-time filtering by company and project. The document generation API endpoint (POST /api/documents/generate) leverages the existing fetchRenderExecute() pipeline, extending it to support achievement ID filtering and custom user instructions with smart preference persistence. Key enhancements beyond the original plan include an improved sidebar navigation system that shows parent items as active for nested routes, and smart user preference saving that only updates the database when instructions differ from both defaults and current preferences. Two critical bugs were identified and fixed during implementation: date filtering requiring both startDate and endDate parameters, and API response structure inconsistencies between the achievements endpoint (wrapped object) and projects/companies endpoints (unwrapped arrays). Comprehensive documentation has been added including a Reports section in docs/FEATURES.md covering user-facing functionality, a new docs/reports.md with detailed technical documentation for developers, and updates to CLAUDE.md reflecting the new API endpoints and directory structure. The feature is production-ready with proper authentication, input validation, error handling, and type safety throughout.

achievements.title: Implemented Welcoming Zero State for New Users on Dashboard
achievements.summary: Added a zero state to guide new users through initial setup on the dashboard.
achievements.details: When new users sign up for BragDoc and navigate to the dashboard, they now see a welcoming zero state instead of an empty page with zero stats. The zero state provides clear, step-by-step instructions for installing the CLI, authenticating, initializing a Git repository, and extracting achievements. This guides users through the initial setup process and helps them understand how to populate their dashboard with data. The implementation adds a new `DashboardZeroState` client component that displays centered content with CLI setup instructions and an interactive "Check for achievements" button. The dashboard page now conditionally renders either the zero state (when `totalAchievements === 0`) or the normal dashboard content (stats, charts, activity stream) based on achievement count. The zero state uses the existing pattern established by `StandupZeroState` with a centered layout constrained to `max-w-2xl` width. The refresh button uses Next.js `router.refresh()` to re-fetch server component data and check if achievements have been added. If still no achievements exist after refreshing, a feedback message appears prompting the user to verify they ran `bragdoc extract`. Once achievements exist, the dashboard automatically transitions to the normal view with populated stats and visualizations.

achievements.title: Implemented Welcoming Zero State for New Users in Dashboard
achievements.summary: Added a zero state to guide new users through initial setup, enhancing user experience.
achievements.details: When new users sign up for BragDoc and navigate to the dashboard, they now see a welcoming zero state instead of an empty page with zero stats. The zero state provides clear, step-by-step instructions for installing the CLI, authenticating, initializing a Git repository, and extracting achievements. This guides users through the initial setup process and helps them understand how to populate their dashboard with data. The implementation adds a new `DashboardZeroState` client component that displays centered content with CLI setup instructions and an interactive "Check for achievements" button. The dashboard page now conditionally renders either the zero state (when `totalAchievements === 0`) or the normal dashboard content (stats, charts, activity stream) based on achievement count. The zero state uses the existing pattern established by `StandupZeroState` with a centered layout constrained to `max-w-2xl` width. The refresh button uses Next.js `router.refresh()` to re-fetch server component data and check if achievements have been added. If still no achievements exist after refreshing, a feedback message appears prompting the user to verify they ran `bragdoc extract`. Once achievements exist, the dashboard automatically transitions to the normal view with populated stats and visualizations.

achievements.title: Implemented Date Transformation for Demo Achievements
achievements.summary: Transformed demo achievement dates to spread evenly over 270 days, enhancing demo freshness.
achievements.details: Demo mode now applies date transformation to achievements during import, spreading them evenly across the last 270 days (approximately 9 months) instead of using the original dates from the source data. This keeps the demo experience fresh without requiring manual updates to the demo data file. The transformation is implemented in `demo-data-import.ts` as a preprocessing step before calling the shared `importUserData()` function. Achievements are sorted by their original `createdAt` date, then dates are recalculated with even spacing across the 270-day window. All date fields (`createdAt`, `eventStart`, `eventEnd`, `updatedAt`, `impactUpdatedAt`) are synchronized to the new calculated dates while all other properties (title, summary, details, impact, foreign keys) remain unchanged. This change only affects demo mode imports. Regular user data imports continue to preserve original dates exactly as before.

achievements.title: Fixed Database Migration System for Safe Vercel Deployments
achievements.summary: Revised the database migration system to use proper migrations, ensuring safe and automated deployment on Vercel.
achievements.details: This change resets the migration history to a single baseline migration representing the complete current schema. The baseline migration (`0000_initial_baseline.sql`) is created by running `drizzle-kit generate` against the current schema.ts and contains all CREATE TABLE, CREATE TYPE, and CREATE INDEX statements. Migrations are now integrated into the Vercel deployment pipeline, running automatically during the build phase before the application starts. This is accomplished through the existing `predeploy` script in apps/web/package.json that runs `pnpm db:migrate`, which executes the migrate.ts script using Drizzle ORM's neon-http migrator. The POSTGRES_URL environment variable must be available during Vercel builds (not just runtime), and Drizzle's built-in database-level locking prevents race conditions if multiple deployment instances attempt to run migrations simultaneously. The dangerous `db:push` workflow is now clearly marked as development-only in package.json scripts with warning messages. The deployment automatically runs migrations on Vercel.

achievements.title: Fixed Achievement Source Classification Bug in CLI
achievements.summary: Corrected the classification of achievements extracted from Git commits, ensuring accurate source tracking and analytics.
achievements.details: Achievements extracted from Git commits via the CLI were being incorrectly saved with source='llm' instead of source='commit'. This bug prevented proper filtering and classification of achievements based on their origin, affecting analytics, reporting, and user understanding of achievement sources. The fix updates five core locations plus additional schema validation and query files: 1. Type definition (packages/database/src/types/achievement.ts) - Added 'commit' to AchievementSource type 2. API endpoint (apps/web/app/api/cli/commits/route.ts) - Changed hardcoded source='llm' to source='commit' 3. CLI batching logic (packages/cli/src/git/batching.ts) - Changed hardcoded source='llm' to source='commit' 4. API client (packages/cli/src/api/client.ts) - Changed default fallback from 'llm' to 'commit' 5. API schema validation (apps/web/app/api/achievements/route.ts, apps/web/app/api/achievements/[id]/route.ts) - Added 'commit' to Zod schemas 6. Database queries (packages/database/src/queries.ts) - Added 'commit' to getAchievements parameter type 7. Tests (packages/cli/src/git/batching.test.ts, apps/web/test/api/cli/commits/route.test.ts) - Updated to expect source='commit'. This is a pure bug fix with no breaking changes. The database schema already supported the 'commit' source, so no migration is required. Manual achievements continue to use source='manual', and impactSource values remain unchanged (still 'llm' for LLM-estimated impact). Comprehensive JSDoc and technical documentation added to clarify the distinction between achievement source (how created) and impact source (how calculated).

achievements.title: Enhanced Achievement Sorting and Display in UI
achievements.summary: Improved sorting of achievements by eventStart and enhanced display for better user experience.
achievements.details: The achievements table was sorting by `createdAt` (when an achievement was recorded in the system) instead of `eventStart` (when the achievement actually occurred). This caused chronologically incorrect ordering, especially problematic for users with historical repositories or bulk imports where achievements from years ago appear first if they were recently imported. Similarly, time period filters ("This Month", "Last 30 Days") were applying to `createdAt` instead of `eventStart`, semantically misaligning with user expectations. This fix updates achievements-table.tsx to sort by `eventStart` (descending) with `createdAt` as a tiebreaker, and updates all time period filters to use `eventStart` instead of `createdAt`. The database query already returns achievements in correct order, so this ensures the front-end respects that ordering. Additionally, the stand-ups page achievement display is enhanced by replacing the cramped custom table layout with the reusable `AchievementItem` component for both assigned and orphaned achievements. This provides visible `eventStart` dates in relative time format (e.g., "3 days ago"), improves responsive design for narrow columns, and maintains consistent UX patterns across the application. Impact rating editing functionality is preserved via the `onImpactChange` callback.

achievements.title: Implemented Achievement Editing in UI
achievements.summary: Added editing functionality to the achievements page, enhancing user interaction and management capabilities.
achievements.details: Add edit capability to achievements page by integrating existing AchievementDialog component with edit mode support. Users can now click an edit button on any achievement in desktop table or mobile list view to open a pre-populated edit dialog, modify fields, and save changes. The implementation wires up onEdit callbacks from child components (AchievementsTable, AchievementItem) to parent dialog state management in AchievementsContent, following existing patterns used for impact rating inline editing. All required backend infrastructure (PUT endpoint, useAchievementMutations hook, form validation) already existed. This integration adds the missing UI triggers and state coordination between components, enabling the full edit workflow while preserving existing functionality for create mode, inline impact editing, filtering, and bulk operations.

achievements.title: Added Edit and Delete Actions for Achievements
achievements.summary: Introduced direct edit and delete actions for achievements, improving user experience and management efficiency.
achievements.details: Replace the dropdown menu in AchievementItem with separate Edit and Delete buttons, providing direct access to these actions across the application. The implementation includes a reusable DeleteAchievementDialog component for confirmations, adds an Actions column to the dashboard Recent Achievements table, and updates the standup page to support achievement deletion. All changes maintain backward compatibility with existing component usage and follow BragDoc patterns for dialogs, forms, and API integration. This work improves the user experience by making achievement management more intuitive and discoverable, while ensuring responsive design across mobile, tablet, and desktop devices. The delete action uses the existing soft-delete pattern (isArchived flag) and properly scopes all operations by userId for security. Key changes: - AchievementItem: Replace dropdown with Edit/Delete buttons, add onDelete callback prop - New DeleteAchievementDialog: Reusable confirmation dialog for destructive actions - Recent Achievements Table: Add Actions column with edit/delete buttons - Standup page: Integrate delete functionality for achievements - All components: Responsive design, proper error handling, security validation.
